main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported in Long Beach, California in November 1957, involving observations of round, bright objects with erratic movements and high speeds, as well as sightings of disc-shaped objects tracked on radar for over 2 hours.
interesting points: One observer reported seeing a round, white object that changed color from white to orange to red, with a vapor trail, and estimated its velocity to be about 500 to 600 miles per hour. The object also appeared to have a metallic glow.

Observers at Norton AFB, March AFB, and Edwards AFB reported sightings of disc-shaped objects that were tracked on radar for over 2 1/2 hours, exhibiting erratic movements and disappearing at times, presumably due to electronic counter-measures.
A citizen living in Long Beach, California reported observing a strange aerial object that later disappeared from view, and ground observers covered the observation.

Deputy Sheriff of Los Angeles County and a private citizen reported observing a bright light in the sky which appeared to be descending. The object hovered over the Griffith Park area of Los Angeles, California, and then moved in a northerly direction at high speed before disappearing.
A military officer observed circular flying objects traveling at a high rate of speed, estimated to be in excess of 700 knots, without any evidence of wings or other aircraft appendages.
sighted object: various unidentified flying objects, including round, bright objects, disc-shaped objects, and metallic glowing objects
witnesses: military personnel, civilian observers, Deputy Sheriff of Los Angeles County, private citizen
